page.title: 03Sandringham House
page.content:
Since the year 1862, when Sandringham House was acquired for the then Prince of Wales, the future King Edward VII, it has become a favourite refuge for the British Monarchy. Indeed, King George V wrote 'Dear old Sandringham, the place I love better than anywhere else in the world.'
The present building is Victorian in the Jacobean style, and it stands in a mature landscaped garden.
Since 1977, when The Queen generously opened the house to the general public, many hundreds of thousands have enjoyed walking through the state rooms of what is a homely residence.
